abstract: Google is tracking the ebb and flow of Web queries like “flu symptoms” in an effort to identify outbreaks.
snippet: Google is tracking the ebb and flow of Web queries like “flu symptoms” in an effort to identify outbreaks.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  There is a new common symptom of the flu, in addition to the usual aches, coughs, fevers and sore throats. Turns out a lot of ailing Americans enter phrases like “flu symptoms” into Google and other search engines before they call their doctors.

headline.main: Google Uses Searches to Track Flu’s Spread
headline.print_headline: Aches, a Sneeze, a Google Search

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
